intro: Borreria repens, commonly known as creeping borreria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Borreria repens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
